S3001.course_title: Bachelor of Science Advanced - Global Challenges (Honours)

requirement_groups.title: S3001 - Complete Requirements
requirement_groups.description: Complete all requirements for Bachelor of Science Advanced - Global Challenges (Honours)

requirement_groups.title: Part C. Free elective study
requirement_groups.description:
You must complete 18 credit points of free elective study.

These elective units may be chosen from units available in the Bachelor of Science course to broaden your science knowledge or to extend your major.

Elective units may also be taken from non-science disciplines as long as you have the prerequisites and there are no restrictions on enrolment in the units.

Free electives can be identified using the Advanced search tool in the current edition of the Handbook. The level of the unit is indicated by the first number in the unit code; undergraduate units are those that commence with the numbers 1-3.

You may need permission from the owning faculty to enrol in some units taught by other faculties.

You cannot take SCI1000 within this course.

requirement_groups.title: Note 2
requirement_groups.description: You must ensure that across the whole course, you complete no more than 60 credit points at Level 1. It is recommended that you complete Level 1 sequences first as these lay the foundation for further study.

requirement_groups.title: Note 4
requirement_groups.description: To remain in the course you are required to maintain at least a distinction average (70%) across all units in each calendar year. If you do not achieve this average you will be required to transfer to S2000 Bachelor of Science.

requirement_groups.title: Note 6
requirement_groups.description: If you successfully complete the first three years (144 credit points) of the course but do not meet the academic standard for progression to the fourth year, you will graduate with the Bachelor of Science.

requirement_groups.title: Note 5
requirement_groups.description: To progress to fourth year, you must complete 144 credit points, including the six Levels 1 to 3 'Impact through science' units. You must also achieve a minimum of a distinction average (70%) in 18 credit points of Level 3 units in the relevant science discipline and the Level 3 'Impact through science' units.

requirement_groups.title: Note 3
requirement_groups.description: You will complete an internship whilst enrolled in SCI3501 Impact through Science 3A (6 credit points). You should complete this before commencement of semester two in the third year of the course.

requirement_groups.title: Note 1
requirement_groups.description: In choosing your 78 credit points of science listed study over Parts A and B, you must ensure that you complete five units (30 credit points) at Level 1 and eight units (48 credit points) at Levels 2 and 3, with a minimum of four units (24 credit points) at Level 3.

requirement_groups.title: Part D. Impact through science project

requirement_groups.title: Part B. Science listed major
requirement_groups.description:
You must complete a Bachelor of Science major.

A major requires eight units with no more than 12 credit points at Level 1 and at least 18 credit points at Level 3.

You may replace the major with an extended major by using elective units available in Part A or Part C.

requirement_groups.title: Level 1 Science sequences
requirement_groups.description:
You must complete at least two approved Level 1 sequences from the disciplines listed below.

The choice of Level 1 sequences will impact your choice of Level 2 and Level 3 units and will normally lay the foundation for a related major.

The two Level 1 sequences must be selected from separate disciplines and cannot have units in common.

If you are studying a single degree course, it is recommended that you take a third Level 1 sequence in the first year to increase your options for choice of major.

requirement_groups.title: Broadening your horizons
requirement_groups.description:
You must complete 12 credit points from the following units.

If you choose ATS1254 or SCI2030, note that only one of these units can be included in your 12 credit points.

Note 1: You need to enrol manually in ATS3229 and ATS2723 by completing an online enrolment amendment form via https://forms.monash.edu/enrolment-amendment;
to enrol in BEX3622 (Prato unit) apply via https://www.monash.edu/business/current-students/beyond-the-classroom

Note 2: For Monash Global Campus Intensives units can be counted as Broadening your horizons units. For more information, please refer https://www.monash.edu/study-abroad/overseas/monash-led-programs/monash-global-campus-intensives

requirement_groups.title: Additional level 2 or 3 science units
requirement_groups.description:
You may complete as many additional Level 2 or 3 science units as necessary to take the total of science listed units to 78 credit points over Parts A and B.

Science listed units are chosen from units listed under any major, extended major or minor offered in S2000 Bachelor of Science or from the following units.

You must complete SCI3501 prior to taking SCI3920.

Note that, for the purpose of this course, MTE4235 is counted as a Level 3 science elective and cannot be used towards the requirement of the 4th year of the course.

requirement_groups.title: MTH1020 Analysis of change
requirement_groups.description: MTH1020 Analysis of change is recommended if you have an interest in mathematics and/or physics. MTH1020 requires you to have studied VCE Mathematical Methods (or equivalent).

requirement_groups.title: SCI1022 Introduction to scientific coding
requirement_groups.description: SCI1022 Introduction to scientific coding is recommended if you want to gain fundamental coding skills that can be applied in a variety of scientific areas. It will be useful for data analysis, modelling of complex systems, data manipulation and visualisation in a scientific context. SCI1022 requires you to have studied VCE Mathematical Methods Units 3 and 4 (or equivalent) or STA1010.

requirement_groups.title: MTH1030 Techniques for modelling
requirement_groups.description: MTH1030 Techniques for modelling is recommended if you have an interest in mathematics and/or physics. MTH1030 requires you to have studied VCE Specialist Mathematics (or equivalent) or MTH1020. If you have a strong mathematics background and a keen interest in the subject you could replace the unit MTH1030 with the advanced version MTH1035. You will need to seek permission from ask.monash to enrol in this unit.

requirement_groups.title: STA1010 Statistical methods for science
requirement_groups.description: STA1010 Statistical methods for science is recommended if you are planning to study areas where experimental design and data analysis skills are particularly important, such as the life sciences. STA1010 requires you to have studied VCE Mathematical Methods Units 3 and 4 (or equivalent).

requirement_groups.title: SCI1020 Introduction to statistical reasoning
requirement_groups.description: SCI1020 Introduction to statistical reasoning is recommended if you are planning to study areas where experimental design and data analysis skills are particularly important, such as the life sciences. SCI1020 is for students without a strong mathematics background.

requirement_groups.title: Mathematics and statistics unit
requirement_groups.description:
You must complete at least 6 credit points from the following units if not already taken as part of a Level 1 approved sequence.

The unit you choose will depend on your mathematics background and interests (see information on units below). You must complete this within the first 48 credit points of your course. It is in your best interest to ensure that you have met pre-requisites for your chosen Level 1 mathematics and statistics unit. For further guidance on your mathematics and statistics unit selection you can refer to the guide provided in the Structure section under Course progression map.

requirement_groups.title: Part A. Science specified study
requirement_groups.description: Although the requirements in Part A appear to exceed 78 credit points, a Level 1 sequence is typically counted towards your chosen major (Part B) and not towards this Part.

requirement_groups.title: Level 1 science sequences
requirement_groups.description:
You must complete at least two approved Level 1 sequences from the disciplines listed below.

The choice of Level 1 sequences will impact your choice of Level 2 and Level 3 units and will normally lay the foundation for a related major. The two Level 1 sequences must be selected from separate disciplines and cannot have units in common.

If you are studying a single degree course, it is recommended that you take a third Level 1 sequence in the first year to increase your options for choice of major.

If you are a first-year student and wish to take Level 2 units you should discuss options with your course coordinator.

requirement_groups.title: Additional level 2 or 3 science unit
requirement_groups.description:
You may complete any additional Level 2 or Level 3 science units required to take the total science listed units to 120 credit points over Parts A and Part B.

Science listed units may be chosen from the units below or units listed under any major, extended major or minor offered in the S2000 Bachelor of Science.

Note that, for the purpose of this course, MTE4235 is counted as a level 3 science elective and cannot be used towards the requirement of the 4th year of the course.

requirement_groups.title: Research project unit
requirement_groups.description:
You must complete one of the following units.

Note: The research project unit is normally taken as part of your chosen major(s). The computational science project is 12 credit points and consists of FIT3161 and FIT3162. These units do not form part of the computational science major but are part of the extended major.

If you major in computational science and want to complete FIT3161 and FIT3162 as your level three research project course requirement, then they will not count towards your major in computational science.

requirement_groups.title: MTH1030 Techniques for modelling
requirement_groups.description: MTH1030 is recommended if you have an interest in mathematics and/or physics. MTH1030 requires you to have studied VCE Specialist Mathematics (or equivalent) or MTH1020. If you have a strong mathematics background and a keen interest in the subject you could replace MTH1030 with the advanced version MTH1035. You will need to seek permission from ask.monash to enrol in this unit.

requirement_groups.title: STA1010 Statistical methods for science
requirement_groups.description: STA1010 is recommended if you plan to study areas where experimental design and data analysis skills are particularly important, such as the life sciences. STA1010 requires you to have studied VCE Mathematical Methods Units 3 and 4 (or equivalent).

requirement_groups.title: MTH1020 Analysis of change
requirement_groups.description: MTH1020 is recommended if you have an interest in mathematics and/or physics. MTH1020 requires you to have studied VCE Mathematical Methods (or equivalent).

requirement_groups.title: SCI1022 Introduction to scientific coding
requirement_groups.description: SCI1022 is recommended if you want to gain fundamental coding skills that can be applied in a variety of scientific areas. It will be useful for data analysis, modelling of complex systems, data manipulation and visualisation in a scientific context. SCI1022 requires you to have studied VCE Mathematical Methods Units 3 and 4 (or equivalent) or STA1010.

requirement_groups.title: Mathematics and statistics unit
requirement_groups.description:
You must complete at least one of the following Level 1 mathematics and statistics units (6 credit points) if not already taken as part of a Level 1 approved sequence.

The unit you choose will depend on your mathematics background and interests (see information on units below). You must complete this within the first 48 credit points of your course. It is in your best interest to ensure that you have met the prerequisites for your chosen Level 1 mathematics and statistics unit. For further guidance on your mathematics and statistics unit selection you can refer to the guide provided in the Structure section under Course progression map.

requirement_groups.title: Additional level 1 units (6 or 12 credit points)
requirement_groups.description:
You must complete any additional Level 1 units (usually one or two) required to take the total Level 1 science listed units to at least 36 credit points.

It is recommended that you consider taking a third Level 1 sequence in your first year to increase your options for choice of major. Science listed units are those under any major, extended major or minor offered in S2000 Bachelor of Science, or Level 1 mathematics and statistics units listed above or from the following units.

requirement_groups.title: Research in practice
requirement_groups.description: You must complete the following unit

requirement_groups.title: Part A. Science specified study
requirement_groups.description: Although the requirements in Part A appear to exceed 24 credit points, the two Level 1 sequences are typically credited towards your majors or minor (Part B) and not towards this Part.

requirement_groups.title: Part C. Free elective study
requirement_groups.description:
You may choose elective units from units available in the S2000 Bachelor of Science course to broaden your science knowledge or to extend your major.

Elective units may also be taken from non-science disciplines as long as you have the prerequisites and there are no restrictions on enrolment in the units. The level of the unit is indicated by the first number in the unit code; undergraduate units are those that commence with the numbers 1-3.

You may need permission from the owning faculty to enrol in some units taught by other faculties.

You cannot take SCI1020 and MTH1010 within this course.

requirement_groups.title: Part B. Science listed major
requirement_groups.description:
You must complete two science listed majors or an extended major plus a minor in a different area of study.

A major requires eight units with no more than two units at Level 1 (12 credit points), and at least three units (18 credit points) at Level 3.

An extended major requires twelve units with no more than four units at Level 1 (24 credit points) and at least four units (24 credit points) at Level 3.

You should ensure that over the course you have completed at least four units (24 credit points) of science listed study at Level 3.

It is recommended that you consider completing Level 2 units in more than one area of science to maximise your choice of major at Level 3.

You should ensure you complete the specific units required for honours in your chosen major.

requirement_groups.title: Note 1
requirement_groups.description:
In choosing your 120 credit points of science listed study over Part A and Part B, you must ensure that you complete six science listed units (36 credit points) at Level 1 and 10 science listed units (60 credit points) at Levels 2 and 3, with a minimum of four (24 credit points) at Level 3.

You must also ensure that across the whole course, you complete no more than 10 Level 1 units (60 credit points). It is recommended that you complete Level 1 sequences first as these lay the foundation for further study.

If you are a first-year student and wish to take Level 2 units you should discuss options with your course coordinator.

requirement_groups.title: Note 3
requirement_groups.description: In order to progress to the fourth year, you must normally complete 144 credit points. You must also achieve a minimum of a distinction average (70%) in 24 credit points of Level 3 units in your intended honours discipline.

requirement_groups.title: Note 4
requirement_groups.description: If you successfully complete the first three years (144 credit points) of the course but do not meet the academic standard for progression to the fourth year, you will graduate with the Bachelor of Science.

requirement_groups.title: Note 2
requirement_groups.description: To remain in the course you are required to maintain at least a distinction average (70%) across all science units in each calendar year. If you do not achieve this average you will be required to transfer to the Bachelor of Science.

requirement_groups.title: Part D. Honours program
requirement_groups.description:
The specific requirements for the honours year are dependent on your field of study. All units will be at Level 4 and in general will include advanced coursework and specified assessment tasks, a thesis component and seminars or oral presentations.

Details of the units of study are in accordance with the requirements for course S3701 Bachelor of Science (Honours).

all_units.DEV3990: Action in anatomy and developmental biology research project
all_units.EAE3000: Earth, atmosphere and environment research project

S3003.course_title: Bachelor of Applied Data Science Advanced (Honours)

requirement_groups.title: S3003 - Complete Requirements
requirement_groups.description: Complete all requirements for Bachelor of Applied Data Science Advanced (Honours)

requirement_groups.title: Part E. Free elective study
requirement_groups.description:
You must complete 24 credit points of electives. Twelve (12) credit points of elective units in your Honours year must be at Level 3 or higher, and be approved by the Honours Coordinator.

Elective units may be chosen from the list of units from Parts B or C not already completed or from across the Universityas long as you have the prerequisites and there are no restrictions on admission to the units.

Free electives can be identified using the Advanced search tool in the current edition of the Handbook. The level of the unit is indicated by the first number in the unit code; undergraduate units are those that commence with the numbers 1-3. You may need permission from the owning faculty to enrol in some units taught by other faculties.

requirement_groups.title: Rules
requirement_groups.description:
The course comprises 192 credit points of which 168 credit points are focussed on Applied Data Science. No more than 10 units (60 credit points) are to be completed at Level 1 in the course.

PROGRESSION TO FOURTH YEAR: In order to progress to the fourth year, you must normally complete 144 credit points comprising 132 credit points as indicated in parts A, B and C and 12 credit points from Part E. You must also achieve a minimum of a distinction average (70%) in 36 credit points of core Level 3 units. If you do not meet the course requirements you will be awarded the Bachelor of Applied Data Science.

requirement_groups.description: You must complete the following sustainability core studies units (24 credit points),  core units from the specialist studies (12 credit points) and electives (12 credit points).

requirement_groups.title: 1. Sustainability core studies
requirement_groups.description: You must complete the following units

requirement_groups.title: Information for Monash and SJTU students
requirement_groups.description:
Monash students will normally commence the first year at Monash (in July), and the second year at SJTU.

Following completion of the academic program at Monash comprising 48 credit points (one year full-time) of study towards the Master of Environment and Sustainability, selected students will travel to China to complete a further 48 credit points (one year full-time) study toward either the Master in Energy and Power, or the Master of Resources and Environment from Shanghai Jiao Tong University (SJTU). The thesis will take place at the end of the second year at SJTU (normally around early June).

SJTU students will normally commence the first year at SJTU, and the second year at Monash (July). They will then return to SJTU to complete the requirements of the thesis.

requirement_groups.title: b. Elective units
requirement_groups.description:
You select elective units from the following (total 15 SJTU credit points):
PE6220 Advanced Engineering Thermodynamics (3 credit points)
PE6201 Advanced Heat Transfer (3 credit points)
PE6120 Advanced Fluid Dynamics in Engineering (3 credit points)
PE6100 Advanced Combustion Theory (3 credit points)
PE6441 New Energy Systems (3 credit points)
ME6522 Basic Principles of Sensors and Mechanical Measurement Systems (3 credit points)
PE6603 Multiphase Transport Fundamentals of Low Carbon Energy (3 credits)
PE6605 Intelligent Control Technology in Energy System (3 credit points)
PE6601 Numerical Methods in Low Carbon Energy Processing (2 credit points)
PE6607 Carbon Neutrality Policy and Technology (2 credit points)
ENVR8150 Carbon Accounting (2 credit points)
ENVR8151 Carbon Economics (2 credit points)
ENVR8153 Business and Climate Change (2 credit points)
ENVR7012 Advanced Carbon Cycle Science and Technology (2 credit points)
ENVR8152 Decision Making for Low Carbon Management (2 credits)
PE8607 Biorenewable Resources and Conversion Technologies (2 credits)
ENVR8163 Sustainable Development Goals of the United Nations (2 credits)
ENVR8164 Emerging Waste Carbon Resource Utilizations (1 credit point)
ENVR8165 Infrastructure for net-zero carbon cities (2 credit points)
PE8609 Hydrogen and Hydrogen Energy Technologies (2 credit points)
PE8611 Battery system modeling and simulation (2 credit points)
PE8613 Net Zero-Carbon Fuels (2 credit points)
PE8615 Fundamentals of Electrochemistry and Battery Technologies (3 credit points)
PE8617 The Interface Science in Low Carbon Systems (2 credit points)
PE8619 Zero Carbon Fuel Combustion (2 credit points)

requirement_groups.title: c. Thesus
requirement_groups.description: Completion of the thesis (before early June)

requirement_groups.title: a. Core SJTU units

CHN0916 Introduction to Chinese Culture (2 credit points)
GE6001 Academic Writing, Standards, and Ethic (1 credit points)
MATH6004 Numerical Analysis (3 credit points)
MATH6015 Optimization Methods (3 credit points)

requirement_groups.title: Corresponding units for the Master of Resources and Environment
requirement_groups.description:
On transferring to SJTU, you will complete studies as approved at SJTU China-UK Low Carbon College (LCC), equivalent to 48 credit points in the Monash Master of Environment and sustainability, as per the requirements of the SJTU course.

While at SJTU, Monash students will be enrolled in 48 credit points of Monash Science Study Abroad units (SSA).

requirement_groups.title: Part B. Broadening expertise
requirement_groups.description:
You must select one study option under the Master in Energy and Power or the Master of Resources and Environment.

On transferring to SJTU, you will complete studies as approved at SJTU China-UK Low Carbon College (LCC), equivalent to 48 credit points in the Monash Master of Green Chemistry and Sustainable Technologies, as per the requirements of the SJTU course.

While at SJTU, Monash students will be enrolled in the following Monash units (48 credit points).

requirement_groups.description: You complete the following units

all_units.ENS5320: Climate change risk, resilience and security

requirement_groups.title: S6009 - Complete Requirements
requirement_groups.description: Complete all requirements for Master of Environment and Sustainability (Double Masters with Shanghai Jiao Tong University)

requirement_groups.title: Part B. Core master's study - Specialist studies
requirement_groups.description:
You must complete:

(a) the core units within the 'Specialist studies' section for the chosen specialisation (18 credit points)

(b) an elective unit from the approved list for the specialisation (6 credit points)

Note: All units must be at Level 5.

While at SJTU, Monash students will be enrolled in the following Monash units (48 credit points).

S6011.course_title: Master of Behaviour and Systemic Change

requirement_groups.title: S6011 - Complete Requirements
requirement_groups.description: Complete all requirements for Master of Behaviour and Systemic Change

requirement_groups.title: Part A. Core studies
requirement_groups.description:
You must complete 48 credit points from the following units.
Note: You may only complete one of ENS5530 or BEX5411, not both.

requirement_groups.title: Health and communities
requirement_groups.description:
You must complete 24 credit points from the following units.
Note: You may only complete one of ENS5910 or ENS5930, not both. If you choose one of these units, you must undertake a project or internship relevant to your Extended study.

requirement_groups.title: In Part A, you will complete:
requirement_groups.description: If you choose the research pathway, in Part A you must complete the following unit instead of BAS5555 and ENS5530 or BEX5411.

requirement_groups.title: In Part B, you will complete:
requirement_groups.description: If you choose the research pathway, in Part B you must complete the following unit and may not select ENS5910 orR ENS5930.

requirement_groups.title: Research pathway (optional)
requirement_groups.description: The research pathway is available to students entering at entry level 1 only. It is subject to meeting grade entry requirements for the thesis units.

requirement_groups.title: Climate change
requirement_groups.description:
You may complete 24 credit points from the following units.
Note: You may only complete one of ENS5910 or ENS5930, not both. If you choose one of these units, you must undertake a project or internship relevant to your Extended study.

requirement_groups.title: Flexible path
requirement_groups.description: You must complete 24 credit points of postgraduate coursework units from across Monashs Faculty offerings. These mustbe at a study Level 5 and you must meet the enrolment requirements of the selected units.

requirement_groups.title: Geopolitics and security
requirement_groups.description:
You must complete 24 credit points from the following units.
Note: You may only complete one of ENS5910 or ENS5930, not both. If you choose one of these units, you must undertake a project or internship relevant to your Extended study.

requirement_groups.title: Part B. Extended study
requirement_groups.description: You must complete 24 credit points from one of the following streams

all_units.BAS5525: Advanced understanding of behaviour and decision making
all_units.ENS5520: Understanding human behaviour to influence change
all_units.APG5619: Community resilience, disaster risk reduction and climate change adaptation
all_units.ENS5901: Research thesis in environment and sustainability A
all_units.ENS5902: Research thesis in environment and sustainability B
all_units.BEX5200: Climate change and carbon management strategies
all_units.ENS5320: Climate change risk, resilience and security
all_units.APG5628: Understanding development: Discourse, practice and power
all_units.LAW5464: Negotiation and influence: Strategy and skills
